definition: to feel a mixture of love and hate
to love/to be fond of/to like/affection/to be inclined (to do sth)/to tend to (happen)
to hate/to regret
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)

sentences.english: Since then, I have a love-hate relationship with PR.
sentences.chinese: 从此以后，我对公关爱恨交加。

sentences.english: Steve has a love-hate relationship with, well, everyone.
sentences.chinese: 每个人和乔布斯的态度都是爱恨交加。

sentences.english: Are you aware that you are a love-hate figure?
sentences.chinese: 你意识到自己让人爱恨交加吗？

sentences.english: But Dillon said he had a love-hate relationship with television.
sentences.chinese: 不过狄龙说他对电视可是爱恨交加。

definition: mixture of love and hate
deeply worried (idiom); to feel anxious
loath to part (idiom); emotionally close and unwilling to separate
want to stop but can't (idiom)/to be unable to stop oneself/to feel an urge to continue
to hate/to regret
to miss/to yearn day and night
to be captivated/to wonder/enchanting
deeply attached/devoted
to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
to detest bitterly (idiom)/implacable hatred/to abhor/anathema
with complex feelings (idiom)
to keep in mind constantly (idiom)
to be fascinated/to be captivated
lit. as if having a fish bone stuck in one's throat (idiom)/fig. very upset and needing to express one's displeasure
to detest/to loathe/to abhor
to have a special fondness (for sth)
